reviews.text: Pretty large selection. They had what I was looking for (new taylor swift), which makes the perfect gift! Quick checkout, nice employees.

Staff here are really welcoming. We don't visit often because when my husband walks in, it's always expensive. (He has a vinyl addiction.)They participate in Record Store Day and host live bands occasionally. I love businesses that create community, and I feel like Creep does that.

Nice shop with friendly staff. I always appreciate digging at stores that have a chill vibe and (any kind of) music in the background. The crates were well organized and stocked with a solid inventory, not loaded with dollar bin-type records. Grabbed a great copy of a Wilco live album from a past RSD and a clean copy of My Morning Jacket's At Dawn for below-Discogs prices. Probably could have walked out with 2-3 more records, but my will was too strong that day. Wish they had store stickers in stock though. Next time.

One of my favorite record stores in Philly. I try to stop by everytime I'm in town. They always have deep cuts and incredible selections. I have to limit myself to how much I'm going to buy everytime I go in because otherwise I'll spend every penny to my name. Staff have always been really friendly and helpful too

Not a huge fan.  Limited selection of records and highly overpriced.  I don't mind paying a little more for something as either a convenience or to give back to a small business, but their prices are higher than hunter (excuse the political).  Two albums that I was hemming and hawing on At Philadelphia Record Exchange for 20 & 25 respectively as I have seen them a hair cheaper, these folks price at 42 and 58.  Same albums. Same condition.  Sales staff were more interested in bsing with each other than helping.  I realized I'm probably a little older than most of their clientele but certain things like music genre shouldn't change on age.  If you're going to have a "metal/punk" section, learn what goes in it.  Dio, IronMaiden, Megadeth, Motorhead are all metal bands.  Hendrix is not. In fairness, half the store is a "head shop" or vape shop or whatever it's called nowadays and since I didn't shop that portion it's not fair to judge that half.  Hence the 3 star rather than a 1. Fortunately I had a free parking spot out front or it would not have been worth the price to park.
